name: Rear Delt Raises
how_to_perform:
1. Stand behind a weight bench or stability ball, holding a dumbbell in each hand.
2. Bend your knees slightly and lean forward at the hips, keeping your back straight.
3. Stretch your arms out to the sides, with your palms facing down and your elbows close to a 90-degree angle.
4. Slowly lift the dumbbells up towards the ceiling until they are Level with your shoulders or higher.
5. Focus on squeezing the rear delt muscles together as you raise the dumbbells.
6. Pause briefly at the top of the movement.
7. Slowly lower the dumbbells back down to the starting position, keeping control throughout the exercise.
short_summary: Rear Delt Raises are an isolation exercise that primarily targets the rear deltoid muscles.
